metadata.title: CVE-2022-4900 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in PHP where setting the environment variablePHP_CLI_SERVER_WORKERS to a large value leads to a heap buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.3 - 8.3.4-1build1
libphp8.3-embed - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3 - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-bcmath - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-bz2 - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-cgi - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-cli - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-common - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-curl - 8.3.4-1build1

php8.3-xml - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-xsl - 8.3.4-1build1
php8.3-zip - 8.3.4-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php8.3 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.3.4-1build1').
